title-group.article-title: “Un oubli total du passé”?The Political and Social Construction of Silence in Restoration Europe (1813–1830)

abstract.p: This article analyzes the social construction of silence in early-nineteenth-century Europe, focusing on France and the Netherlands. In both countries, the newly installed Restoration monarchies propagated a “politics of forgetting” of the problematic recent past of the revolution and the Napoleonic era as an essential part of attempts to build a stable and legitimate political order. This official forgetting was contested in both countries. On the basis of the “letters of adhesion,” the article examines the close interaction between the individual reconstruction of the personal past and social forgetting. Finally, it relates the rise of a historicizing culture in the early nineteenth century to the culture of silence in Restoration Europe.

Renan observed in his famousQu'est-ce qu'une nation?(1882) that “The essence of a nation is that all individuals have many things in common, and also that they have forgotten many things.” He believed that the amnesia of former discord and civil conflicts is a precondition for the formation of a national identity: “Forgetting and I would even go so far as to say historical error, are a crucial factor in the creation of a nation.” Around the same time Friedrich Nietzsche published his secondUnzeitgemässe Betrachtungon the uses of forgetting and the dangers of too much history, Vom Nutzen und Nachtheil der Historie für das Leben (:E.W. Fritsch,1874). For an intellectual history of “forgetting” in the Western tradition, see H. Weinrich , Kunst und Kritik des Vergessens (:Beck,2005).

However, in the last decade the problem of “forgetting” has received increasing attention from memory scholars and is no longer regarded as the mere absence of memory. Recent general studies on “social forgetting” are: Oliver Dimbath and Peter Wehling , eds., Soziologie des Vergessens: Theoretische Zugänge und empirische Forschungsfelder (:UVK,2011); Paul Connerton , How Modernity Forgets (:Cambridge University Press,2009); Elena Esposito , Soziales Vergessens: Formen and Medien des Gedächtnisse der Gesellschaft (:Suhrkamp,2002); Adrian Forty and Susanne Küchler , eds., The Art of Forgetting (:Berg,1999); Gary Smith and Hinderk M. Emrich , eds., Vom Nutzen des Vergessens (:Akademie Verlag,1996); Christian Meier , Das Gebot zu Vergessen und die Unabweisbarkeit des Erinnerns: Von öffentlichen Umgang mit schlimmer Vergangenheit (:Siedler Verlag,2010).

An example of this type of research into forgetting is W. Frijhoff , De mist van de geschiedenis: Over herinneren, vergeten en het historisch geheugen van de samenleving (:Vantilt,2012); Astrid Erll , Memory in Culture , trans. Sara B. Young (:Palgrave Macmillan,2011),8–9.
